p: Identified phenolics were present in all extracts, regardless of the site of the plant material collection. Variability was reflected through relatively small differences in the concentrations of individual constituents. The content of chlorogenic acid was in the range between 23.35 and 33.46 mg/g, whereas rosmarinic acid was present in lower amounts (3.53â€“17.98 mg/g) ( Table 4). Among the analyzed preparations, sample 4E was the richest in chlorogenic and rosmarinic acids.
